newsitem.title: INDIA: India industry seen growing at 11 pct in 97/98 - PTI.
newsitem.headline: India industry seen growing at 11 pct in 97/98 - PTI.

text.p: India's industrial output is expected to grow by at least 11 percent during the current fiscal year 1997/98 (April-March), the Press Trust of India (PTI) quoted the Industry Secretary as saying.
"We are optimistic that industrial growth would be at least 11 percent in 1997-98 and the exports would also be on the upswing," the newsagency quoted T.R. Prasad as saying.
Industrial output grew by only 6.7 percent in 1996/97 compared with 11.6 percent in the previous year.
The Industry Ministry was working out a strategy to boost industrial growth, Prasad said, adding that the current slowdown was a "passing phase".
"Though it is too early to make any firm prediction, there are unmistakable signals of buoyancy in stock markets which could be taken as a lead indicator of a growth upswing," Prasad said.
